flawed_nl_solution:
The discount is 45*0.2=$<<45*0.2=9>>9 off each pair
So she pays 45-9= $<<45-9=36>>36 each
So it will cost 36*10=$<<36*10=360>>360 before tax
The tax will add 360*0.1=$<<360*0.1=63>>63
So she has to pay 360+63=$<<360+63=423>>423
#### 423

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 36, not 63. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
